page.title: 10FARMING:MARKET GARDENING
page.content: {Potton}is a good area for market gardening because the{soil}is light, soft and{sandy}and therefore easy to work with. There are three or four {market gardeners in Potton.}Others, for example, those previously connected with the{Land Settlement {Association}may combine market gardening and horticulture. The L.S.A. started in the 1930's for the unemployed. It finally finished in March 1983 and people bought the land and started up their own businesses. The three acre market garden we visited produces spinach, rhubarb, pumpkins, lettuces, spring onions, curly kale, sprouting broccoli, brussel sprouts, calabrese, carrots, sweetcorn, courgettes, chives, parsley, turnips and parsnips. Most of {Potton's produce}is transported by {lorry to London.}Some is sold{locally.
